ai_analysis.summary: Payer has a prior escalation count of 1, triggering an automatic rejection per policy, despite a low ML fraud score; additionally, the written amount and date fields are missing, preventing full validation.
reasoning: Policy Override: Escalation count = 1 for this payer mandates rejection, regardless of any other factors.
Signature Present: Signature field is present, so no mandatory‐signature failure, but policy override still applies.
Missing Written Amount & Date: Absence of written amount and date hinders cross-field consistency checks (45% of fraud cases have amount/date mismatches in training data).
Low ML Score Insufficient: Although the ensemble model risk score is 0.0%, policy for repeat escalations overrides model outputs.
No Similar Legitimate Cases: No comparable past approvals for repeat-escalated payers, reinforcing strict stance.
actionable_recommendations: Inform the purchaser that the money order is rejected due to prior escalation history and incomplete fields.
Advise the purchaser to submit a new money order with both numeric and written amounts, plus a valid date.
Require the purchaser to present government-issued ID and verify in person before acceptance.
